intro: Impatiens chekiangensis, commonly known as the Chinese impatiens, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the family Balsaminaceae and is characterized by its delicate, showy flowers that range in color from white to pink and red. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments and has opposite, ovate leaves with serrated edges. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and as a houseplant. The species is also noted for its ability to thrive in partial shade and well-drained soil.
